name: Elder Black Pudding
description: The Elder Black Pudding is a gigantic, amorphous ooze that can pass through narrow openings and has a viscous, black appearance. It is capable of climbing surfaces and moving upside down.
memorable: Its ability to split into smaller puddings and corrode nonmagical weapons makes it a terrifying opponent.
goals: Typically seeks to engulf creatures and defend its territory.
relations: May be found alongside other oozes or in areas where rot and decay prevail.
environment: Often dwells in dungeons, sewers, or anywhere dark and damp.
strengths: Immunities to many damage types and the ability to corrode weapons provide strong defenses.
weaknesses: Sunlight sensitivity and its low intelligence prevent it from using complex strategies.
attacks: Uses pseudopod attacks to deal bludgeoning and acid damage, while also corroding armor.
most_powerful_ability: The ability to split into two smaller puddings when damaged by lightning or slashing, potentially overwhelming foes.
senses: Possesses blindsight out to 60 feet, allowing it to detect nearby creatures.
skills: Very low passive perception at 8, highlighting its lack of insight.
additional_information: Can pass through openings as narrow as 1 inch.
Any creature touching it takes acid damage.
Nonmagical weapons made of metal or wood become damaged over time.
Resilient due to not needing air or sleep.
Can move upside down on ceilings.
test_queries: puddle creature that absorbs physical attacks
giant ooze immune to many damage types
